Job Description: Supervise the maintenance and operation of all lifting equipment and related accessories used in the field and ensure that all these activities are carried out in accordance with correct procedures and required standards. Develop and submit complete lift plans for all heavy lifts to the Health & Safety Department and other departments before any lifting operation. Supervise assigned employees to ensure that their works are carried out correctly and safely. Train and develop assigned tasks on relevant skills to enable them to become proficient on their job.

Imagine yourself going to work with one thing on your mind: you want to get feedback and build good working relationships with your colleagues. As you tackle your new tasks for the day, you know that it will all lead to one thing that your department believes in: that you will ensure facility cleanliness, orderliness, and maintain the quality of equipment and furnishings. As a Facilities Officer, implementing safety procedures and managing projects are your priorities. You will monitor and oversee security and housekeeping. In terms of employee engagement, you will solicit constant feedback from all employees on the site and ask them about working conditions by implementing regular floor walks, focus group discussions, and surveys. You will provide timely resolution of concerns and formulate programs that will increase employee satisfaction. In terms of equipment maintenance, you will perform regular inspection of furniture and fixtures, bulbs and lightings, electrical outlets, and plumbing fixtures to ascertain that these are in good working condition. You will also implement preventive maintenance of all TaskUs-owned equipment and coordinate the maintenance of building-owned equipment. You will conduct initial check-ups and troubleshooting of malfunctioning equipment and provide recommendations when needed. Meanwhile, in terms of housekeeping, you will assist the Facility Supervisor/Manager in implementing the site's housekeeping program and implement the effective scheduling of utility personnel to support operations. You will monitor and ensure that housekeeping supplies, pantry supplies, and toiletries are available at all times. You will also ensure the cleanliness and orderliness of the reception, operations area, offices and conference rooms, and restrooms. What else? In terms of security, you will assist the facility supervisor/manager in managing the physical security operations of the site and coordinate the investigation and correction of security issues in the site. In helpdesk management, you will respond to requests of operations teams and other support groups related to equipment setup, venue preparation, permit processing, etc. You will handle the closure of repairs, site maintenance, housekeeping, and security concerns filed thru the helpdesk. You will also ensure the adequacy of equipment, furniture, and lockers for use by individual representatives. In terms of incident management, you will respond to any incident related but not limited to power, aircon, water, safety, and with the downtime of TaskUs or building-owned equipment which impact operations. You will also provide first-hand analysis, troubleshooting, and coordination of repairs to vendor or contractor. In terms of safety, you will implement the safety program of the company and act immediately to correct any unsafe acts or hazards that pose risks to Taskus employees. You will assist government-authorized officials in site inspections related to safety. You will also handle the closure of the findings or recommendations from site inspections. You will conduct monthly check-ups of fire extinguishers, emergency lights, FM 200, and rectify any deficiencies noted. You will also coordinate the annual fire drill with the building. In terms of PMO project management, you will provide logistic support to the project management team for PM-related projects. You will lead and implement improvement projects initiated by the facilities team. You will also coordinate with vendors or contractors on the implementation of the SOW. You will provide assistance on ingress and egress of vendor or contractor works in Taskus secured areas. So, do you have what it takes to become a Facilities Officer? About Us We are a collective of highly capable humans, who understand how to deploy technology and data to best serve your purpose. From Digital CX to Content Security, AI Operations, Consulting, and anything in between, we consider ourselves responsible for protecting our partners’ interests and supporting their long term success through innovation and technology -powered by ridiculously smart people. TaskUs partners with the world’s most innovative and disruptive brands to protect what matters most and to thrive in an ever-changing world. TaskUs currently has over 23,000 employees around the world with offices across the United States, the Philippines, India, Taiwan, Mexico, Greece, and Ireland. TaskUs is an equal opportunity employer.

POSITION SUMMARY: The Office Surveyor is responsible to make exact measurements and determine property boundaries. He/she provides data relevant to the shape, contour, gravitation, location, elevation, or dimension of land features on or near the earth’s surface for engineering, map making, mining, land valuation, construction, and other purposes. QUALIFICATIONS: Graduate of Bachelor of Science in Geodetic Engineering At least 6-8 years of working experience in raw and land developments using Total Station. Must be a licensed Geodetic Engineer with good standing. Must know how to operate Total Station, Automatic Level, and other surveying equipment. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: KEY ACCOUNTABILITY 1 Verify accuracy of survey data including measurements and calculations conducted at survey site. Search legal, records, survey records, and land titles to obtain information about property boundaries in areas to be surveyed. Calculates heights, depths, relative positions, property lines, and other characteristics of terrain. Prepare and maintain sketches, maps, reports and legal descriptions of surveys to describe, certify and assumes liability for work performed. Direct or conduct surveys to establish legal boundaries for properties, based on legal deeds and titles. Prepares or supervises preparation of all data, charts, plots, maps, records, and documents related to surveys. Writes descriptions of property boundaries for used in deeds, leases, or other legal documents. Compute geodetic measurements and interprets survey data to determine positions, shapes and elevation topographic features. Determine longitudes and latitudes of important features and boundaries in survey areas using total stations, levels and satellite based global positioning system. (GPS) Records the results of surveys including the shape, contour, location, elevation, dimension of land and land features. KEY ACCOUNTABILITY 2 Coordinates findings with the work of engineering and architectural personnel, clients, and other concerned with the projects. Establish fixed points for use in making maps, using geodetic and engineering instruments. Train assistant and helpers, and directs their work in such activities as performing surveys or drafting maps. Plans and conducts ground surveys designed to establish baselines, elevations, and other geodetic measurements. Adjust surveying instruments to maintain their accuracy. Analyze survey objectives and specifications to prepare survey proposals or to direct others in survey proposal preparation. Develop criteria for survey methods and procedures. Develops criteria for design and modification of survey instruments.

Job Summary: The position performs a significant role in helping realize the organization’s mission of “Building Sustainable Futures” in underserved rural communities. The position provides the opportunity to work with an entrepreneurial, investment savvy and innovative team of business development, finance and marketing experts committed to bridge the gap between funds and investments opportunities in Southeast Asia, engage with various stockholders, and obtain a broad knowledge base across a range of business development functions as well as exposure in investments opportunities in energy, modern agriculture and tourism. The position shall lead the development activities of the company through-out the exploration, pre-development and implementation phases of the target project until turnover. It shall manage the project 4Ms and project risks. The position shall harmonize the commercial, technical, legal and financial aspects of the projects in order to deliver a high-quality project, within the agreed timeline and in accordance to approve project budget. Externally, position shall have regular and constant interface with government regulators, local government, off-takers, and third-party entities such as consultants, suppliers and/or contractors. Key responsibilities: 1. Lead the exploration activities of the target project ensuring the delivery of: Market and techno-economic studyFinancial and Business modelSite Acquisition 2. Manage project planning activities ensuring delivery of: Regulatory contracts, licenses and permitsCommercial terms and contractsDetailed project plans and design 3. Oversee facility and site development activities ensuring delivery of: Constructions and site developmentMachinery and equipment installationPre-operations plans and designs 4. Others: Attend industry events, research meetings, etc. to broaden network of consultants and prospectsBuild network of Business partnersExperienced in Project monitoring and Budget implementation Qualifications: With at least 5 years solid work experience in Project Management and/or Business DevelopmentProven Project Management skills and has demonstrated leadership capabilities.Strong analytical skills, strategic thinking, ability to identify risk scenarios and capable of handling themHas the capacity to understand and analyze technical data, plans and strategiesExcellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills.Result-driven, has the ability to build networks and business partnershipsCreative Deliverer (Inquisitive, continuously thinks how to improve and add Value to deliverable and not afraid to challenge convention).Willing to travel. Field work is required.Dynamic and flexible.Willing to be assigned at Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City

Position: Demand Planner Reports To: Business Unit Manager / Officer Job Purpose : To ensure availability of products in all warehouses through a timely raising Purchase Order and replenishment; To collaborate with all concerned functions and with Principal in coming up with a reliable forecast; To conduct research and formulate tools for the accurate computation of forecasts, orders and replenishments Job Functions: Inventory Management - Monitor daily Inventory; analyze availability, out of stock, critical stock and overstock; publish report Demand Forecasting - set and update rolling forecast based on parameters as aligned with Principal (past demand/orders, focus SKUs, calendar of promos and initiatives) Purchase Order - prepare monthly PO in accordance with agreed rolling forecast, observing agreed/contracted lead time with Principal Branch Replenishment - compute weekly replenishment to depots Market research - Review historical sales trends, research demand drivers, prepare forecast data, develop statistical Job Functions: Create Report Templates - Customize reports aligned with needs of Principal; coordinate with IT on auto system generation and sending of customized reports Perform tasks for stock transfers, stock transformation and adjustments Create forecast from validated market research information and analyses of inventory and service levels Monitor ICR for Conversion and/or Receiving of Shipments from Principal; Track Principal Fill Rate; Compute Forecast Accuracy Job Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering or related field Minimum of one (1) year experience in forecasting/demand planning and inventory tracking and reporting Minimum 2 years of experience in FMCG; distribution experience an advantage Highly proficient in the Microsoft Office with strong emphasis in Microsoft Excel Familiarity with SAGE, or SAP/ERP Software (advantage)

Job Purpose The Quarry Operations Manager is accountable and responsible for planning, co-ordination and control of a quarry operation. Job Responsibilities • Responsible for the day to day quarry operations and associated activities and ensure that the plant’s requirements for raw materials are met in both terms of volume and quality. • Lead and develop a sustainable health and safety culture and environmental excellence, with respect of all activities associated with projects works • Generates short term, medium term and long term raw material extraction and development plan to satisfy the raw material requirement of the plant in terms of quality, quantity, cost efficiency without sacrificing safety and environment and social considerations • Provide working programs for operators and drivers not limited to delivery of materials, but also in maintenance of loading areas, safety berms and haul roads for safety purposes. • Sustain the production requirements of crusher plants. • Line up in proper matching of mobile equipment to its designated area. Job Qualification • Bachelor’s degree in Mining Engineering preferably licensed Engineer. • At least three (3) years related experience in quarry activities where two years of which are from Quarry operation and one year experience in mine engineering and planning • Able to deliver effective results, meet tight deadlines and targets • Ability to interact with staff (at all levels) in a fast paced environment, sometimes under pressure, flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient. • Must be willing to relocate and be assigned in Taysan, Batangas.

General Job Description The Operations Manager is primarily responsible for successfully initiating, planning, designing, executing, monitoring, controlling, and completing all projects. Responsible for the implementation of the Quality Management System. Promote and ensure that the Company’s Vision, Mission, Quality Policy, and Policies and Procedures are understood and implemented throughout the project. Provide feedback and suggestions to Management regarding improvements in the working conditions of the team. Responsible for the development of direct reports. Operational Manage the over-all operation of projects. Estimate and revalidate material, equipment, tools, and manpower costs for all projects. Lead the environmental, health, and safety program in the project sites. Capacity Building – Develop and manage the application of effective mentoring and capacity-building frameworks for displaced communities to help them establish sustainable systems for administering and maintaining their replacement villages and infrastructure. High level of awareness in health, safety, environment and stakeholder engagement practices and standards Advanced computer literacy, particularly in MS Office applications.

JOB DESCRIPTION: Coordinates with incoming / out coming process technician regarding the progress of operation, production problems, update & quality status. Coordinates with post operator regarding quality of inline extruded pipes. Reports to the shift supervisor for any instructions or job assignment, product quality status, special information and other. Monitors, check and documents establish standard process parameters in accordance to the standard quality parameters. Sets such as dimension, color & appearance including result of lab test. Performs necessary corrective and preventive action in accordance with the engineering for any abnormalities and observation on the part of the machines that effect. Responsible in heat up of machines & equipments, troubleshooting, preparation and shutdown procedure. Supervises and monitor service crew in his section during set-up of SOP's operation, preparation, cleanliness, and orderliness. Monitors material quality, adequacy and discourage spillages. Identifies and reports to supervisor all unsafe act and unsafe condition. Makes sure that all water returns, drainage are de-clogged, trash free and no spills. Recommend process & work method improvements and innovations. JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Graduate of ANY Engineering course or equivalent. Licensed or Non - Licensed, with or without experience. Applicant must be willing to work in Marilao, Bulacan. 30 full-time positions available for expansion.

Job Description: Identify and explore the potential sites for hydroelectric development.Evaluate or review the feasibility of hydroelectric power projects under development.Conduct or oversee the conduct, of field investigations on matters such as hydro-meteorology, water quality, environment, topography, geology and coordinates data collection with local agencies and designers.Interprets hydro-meteorological data and performs analysis in determining water availability, design flood, diversion flood for hydroelectric projects.Conduct Power Potential Assessment; determine design flow and optimum installed capacity for hydroelectric projects.Perform ecological study to determine the environmental flow and assist in securing Water Permit for the Company’s Hydro Electric Projects.Carryout Hydrological and Hydraulics assessment for other Water Infrastructure and drainage Projects.Coordination with design consultants for the preparation of Feasibility Study and Detailed Engineering Design of the Projects.Coordinate with Electro-mechanical suppliers and assist in procurement of the equipment for the Hydroelectric Projects.Attends in meetings/seminars conducted by various government agencies in alternate with other staff of Company.Provide technical assistance to the Project team in securing endorsements/permits from Local Government Units (LGUs) and govt. agencies such as DENR, NWRB and NCIP.Perform other duties and responsibilities that may be assigned by higher management from time to time. Minimum Qualifications: Graduate of Civil Engineering.Atleast 3 years experience in hydrological and hydraulic studies for various infrastructure projects. Experience with Hydropwer project is preferred.Experience in establishing river gauging stations, carrying out river flow and rainfall measurements and developing rating curves.Experience in carrying out water availability studies and flood analysis.Experience in carrying out power potential assessment of hydro power projectsexperience in hydraulic design of weir, intake, desander, water pipelinesexperience with GIS, HEC - RAC and HEC - HMS softwares.

Qualifications Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree, Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam) in Physics or equivalent. At least 3 Year(s) of working experience in optical system design, production, “hands-on” optical measurement and analysis. Optics engineer who has experience in different measurement techniques that can be utilized to characterize camera imaging quality and performance of optics. Familiar with industrial and automotive standards. LabView or Matlab experience is highly appreciated. Basic know-how on optical design and simulation software such as Zemax and CodeV. Basic know-how on mechanical design and simulation software such as Solidworks. Appreciation in the product realization processes and basic understanding of the EMS industry. Knowledgeable in statistics, including proficiency in the use of Excel for data analysis and presentation. Specifications Conceive and analyze optical designs for imaging camera and illumination. Develop procedures that will enable manufacturing and testing of the designed systems. Interface with mechanical and electrical specialists to complete systems modeling, analysis and methods of performance verification. Prepare and review test plans, acceptance test procedures, and first article test procedures. Provide technical support to our partners (Technology development and production partner companies). Participate in the decision process for technology / equipment selections – EMVA and ISO Standard in Optics compliant testing. Perform Optical Simulations Prepare publications that can be presented at strategic symposiums and conferences that will promote the capabilities of the company.

Company: OVE ARUP AND PARTNERS HONG KONG LIMITED (Philippines Branch)
Job Description: Duties & Responsibilities: Produce Rail Systems Engineering design / consultancy for projects. Coordinate and liaise with external parties in producing engineering deliverables. Provide process leadership for Railway Systems Project related technical reviews. Manage the production of reports, technical assessments, drawings, plans, and other deliverables. Communicate with clients to obtain information and establish their needs. Support in writing proposals for bids associated with Rail Systems Engineering / Systems Assurance. Desired Skills and Qualifications: Bachelors Degree in Railway Engineering and / or Management, associated Engineering Discipline or Systems Engineering or Electrical Engineering. At least 5 years domain expertise in rail related project or production environment or specialist rail related sub-system discipline such as Rolling Stock, AFC, PSD, OLE, traction etc. Experience in providing detailed technical review input for railway system development / upgrade projects preferably on major rail projects for system suppliers, engineering firms or consultants. Knowledge and practical experience in leading the application of RAMS analysis techniques, e.g. FTA/ETA, FMEA, HAZOP, RBD, Bowtie, SIL, FRACAS etc. Experience working on input to Systems Assurance/RAMS and System Engineering processes delivered against the EN5012x family of standards within that discipline. Good knowledge of Engineering Safety Management (The Yellow Book / iESM). Experience in O&M and/or Project Management techniques (e.g. schedule management, cost management etc.).

Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam), Marine Engineering. With at least 5 years of experience in Pier Facility Security. With experience in petroleum industry is an advantage. Proven Leadership and Management Skills. Knowledgeable with the INTERNATIONAL SHIP AND PORT FACILITY SECURITY. Familiar with Philippines Coast Guard, Philippines Ports Authority and Maritime OSH regulatory requirements. Willing to be assigned in Davao. Full-Time position(s) available. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Job Ojectives To assist the Terminal Manager on the implementation of the safety regulations and operations of Wharf safely and efficiently. This includes coordination with various tenant users and supply group for the timely and orderly scheduling of vessel dockings. WHARF MANAGEMENT 1. Clears import and domestic vessels for docking at IOC Davao.2. Coordinates with tenant users and Supply Department for the orderly scheduling of vessel dockings.3. Coordinates with the service providers the provision of tugs and moorings for domestic vessel docking.4. Coordinates, liaise and represent IOC with matters related to PPA that would affect the operations of IOC pier. This includes new regulation and permit requirements.5. Coordinates, liaise and represent IOC with various government agencies such as police and army intelligence groups for various security cooperation related to pier operations.6. Manages the manpower requirements of pier operations to ensure that enough personnel are on hand in each and every vessel loading and receiving.7. Responsible for the safe, orderly and efficient use of all pier assets including its repairs and maintenance, cleanliness and safe operation.8. Approves all billings for terminal charges for both import and domestic vessel dockings.9. Develops and implements monitoring procedures for the tenants’ inventories, including its gains and losses.10. Develops and maintains monitoring templates of all billings made to all vessels docking at IOC Terminal including its timely collections and remittances to Treasury Department.11. Manages and approves all vessel boarding and disembarkation requests from agents which may include sire inspection, audits, personnel singing on and off and shore leaves and chandling. Coordinates with vessel officials to ensure that crew complies with the terminal safety regulations during shore leave availment.

TEST ENGINEER - R&D DEVELOPMENT We are looking for someone that is eager to learn in an Engineering Test environment. Must have the ability to analyze problems along with offering solutions with senior engineers. Must be Detail oriented. Bachelor of Science degree in EE or ECE required. Must be a Licensed Electrical/Electronic Engineer. College Graduate welcome to apply. Responsible for day to day laboratory activities related to the construction materials testing. Stripping and labelling of samples Hands-on lab work working with cement, aggregates, concrete and other construction materials. Preparing and recording of materials (drying, weighing, measurement and others) prior to testing. Perform all testing procedures per applicable standards with documentation and analyzation of results Keeping track of laboratory samples. Preparation of reports or memos on assigned tasks or projects, including conclusions and proposed solution Minimum Qualifications A graduate of Civil Engineering Technology, Materials Engineering; or any related course. Responsibilities: Conducts the daily inspection of all machinery and equipment, making sure that these are in good working condition. Schedules the maintenance and repair of all plant machinery and equipment. Assigns, supervises and evaluates the work of the Maintenance personnel. Troubleshoots machinery and equipment problems, if necessary. Requests and follows up, if necessary, the outside/technical services and additional tools needed by the Maintenance Section. Coordinates with the machine shops for the fabrication of machine parts. Reports machinery/equipment failure and the status of machinery/equipment maintenance and repair work to the Plant Manager. Prepares the plant's energy consumption report (electricity, water, fuel, LPG) and submits this to Management. Plans, supervises and reports the plant improvements to Management. Acts as the Pollution Control Officer for the manufacturing plant. Oversees the working condition of the plant's wastewater treatment facility and air pollution devices. Prepares the quarterly Self-Monitoring Reports, forwards these to the Main Office for signature and notarization, and then submit these to the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR). Prepares and forwards to the Main Office the required documents that will be submitted to the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) for permit renewal purposes. Prepares and forwards to the Main Office the required documents that will be submitted to the Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) for permit renewal purposes. QUALIFICATIONS: Licensed Mechanical Engineer. At least 2 year(s) work experience, preferably in a food manufacturing environment. Computer literate. Above average oral and written English communication skills. Responsible, has initiative and can work well under pressure Able to multitask. Willing to be assigned in the night shift schedule. Applicants must be willing to work in Mandaluyong City. 2 Full-Time position(s) available.

The main role of the Engineer will be (this list is for us to keep in mind when interviewing the candidates): Expand Silicon Validation capability for new modules, new designs To evaluate new module is in general working as defined/intended as soon as possible, ie within the first week or so of receiving first working silicon – even for modules that are not yet supported by Autoval tool. We really need the very senior level engineer because of this. To evaluate where new modules/silicon is working, and where it breaks To recommend improvements where needed, report bugs when found, and able to describe the issue very clearly. When a bug is found, he/she may need to prove and test it in several ways as part of the analysis. Initial focus for the 6-9 months will be on Autoval 2.0 to get us over the hump. Job Requirements: BSc or Masters in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science, with 4+ years of experience in Software/Hardware design experience Develop C/C++ Applications to test new Silicon or new Analog and Digital modules Develop GUI’s using C-Sharp to create user friendly tools to be used by other engineers within Microchip Drive definition of and develop of Application Software/Firmware Design the software tools with System Quality Assurance in mind for reliable and robust test systems Expertise in hardware and system level design experience and knowledge in schematic design and layout Must be able to read and interpret written specifications, and implement software solutions from those specifications Must be able to provide technical support to internal customers, verbally and in writing. Must be able to work with worldwide teams located across US, India, and Europe Must have strong verbal and written abilities in English language Familiarity with cross-platform development and debugging tools Familiarity with command line build tools Proven leadership skills is a plus

Job Title: Permitting and Compliance Officer (Electricity and Power)
Job Description: o Act as overall coordinator to ensure compliance with all government guidelines in securing permits o Coordinate with all respective departments, personnel, and executive officers to ensure the completeness of required documentation o In-charge of collating all documents prior to submission o Ensure on-time submission of the permit, registration, and other required business-related documents for the application. o Monitoring and securing all permit renewals, quarterly and annual renewals, and reports required by the government and private agencies o Preparation and submission of required reports. o Deal and coordinate with the following government agencies; Department of Energy (DOE) Energy Regulatory Commission (ERC) Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) Board of Investments (BOI) Laguna Lake Development Authority (LLDA)

Responsibilities: Fluence seeks an Energy Storage Commissioning Engineer to drive energy storage project commissioning and to support project delivery. The Energy Storage Commissioning Engineer will:• Commission Fluence Projects working in cooperation with multiple project stakeholders including Fluence construction managers, contractors, suppliers, telecommunication teams, control systems teams, etc.• Develop and execute commissioning plans including resourcing and scheduling.• Lead commissioning effort to achieve commercial operations, and handover from delivery/construction team to the O&M team for each project.• Define, develop, and execute testing protocols based on market rules, local utility requirements, off-taker and third-party supply contracts.• Oversee complete commissioning and acceptance testing of the following systems:1) project networks, communications, and control systems;2) balance of plant relay protection, metering, HVAC, fire suppression, and electrical systems;3) battery subsystem;4) inverter subsystem• Perform electricity market and/or off-taker qualification testing as required for the project to commence commercial operations. Responsilbilities: Undergraduate degree in electrical engineering with least four year’s professional work experience in related field, such as construction, commissioning, project management, performance testing, and troubleshooting.• Knowledge and experience with SCADA protocols such as: IEC60870-5-101/- 103/104, IEC 61850 MMS, DNP3 & Modbus.• Working knowledge on PLC (Siemens S7 & Allen Bradley ControlLogix PLC), soft logic IEC 61131, SEL Relays & Meters, Siemens Relays & Meters & SCADA Gateways & Data Concentrators.• Experience with Managed Ethernet Switches, Media Converters (Fiber & Serial).• Proven success on challenging projects where you made key contributions while demonstrating ownership, creativity, and initiative.• Demonstrated ability and interest in engineering design; ability to write specifications and work plans for others to implement.• Passion for your work, and communication skills such that your passion motivates colleagues, clients, suppliers, and contractors.• Effective in a collaborative yet informally structured work environment.• Desire to take responsibility and initiative.• Proven capability in managing contractors and working in a matrix organization on fast moving projects.• Solid skills on MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.

Candidate must possess at least Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam) in Engineering (Civil) or equivalent. At least 10 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. With extensive experience in vertical, road, bridges, infra, marine, and horizontal projects. Job Description: Report to a Project Engineer (if any) or in case of sufficient seniority perform part of project engineering functions. In case of insufficient seniority report to an Expert Method Engineer or to a Project Engineer. Draw up a general engineering schedule as stipulated by the contract to be revised by the Project. Identify technical problems and make the necessary technical decisions within the limitations imposed by contractual requirements. Draw up definitions and detailed specifications of tasks and sub-tasks or supervise their drafting by other resources if requested. Define the materials or services to be purchased for engineering tasks within the allocated resource budget, in conjunction with the Project Engineer. Approve all the technical design necessary for the purchase and/or construction of products to be supplied to the Client. Participate to meetings to examine and, if necessary, audit the technical design, and take part in technical examinations with the Client. Cost and scheduling decisions which influence contractual obligations or other functions must be approved by the Project Engineer (if any) and communicated to the Engineering Manager and Project Manager. Notify the Project Engineer (if any) and Engineering Manager of any problems occurring with any other engineering areas. Perform all the necessary engineering verifications and calculations necessary for the methodology to be implemented. Supervise and verify the drafting describing the methodology to be implemented. Summarize and clarify in a manual all methodology activities, clearly identifying the show stoppers (if any). Transfer inside the manual all useful data derived by analyses performed by others. Ensure that the operation people on site receive all useful data in form of reports, manuals, drawings. Follow up activities onshore or in any construction place deemed necessary by the project. All the above activities could be performed with different level of deepness for Project or Bid assistance performance. Ensure the Management of Outsourced Engineering with Subcontractors.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES 1.Monitor all movement of vessel and ensure that voyage instructions are carried out until commercial completion. 2.Ensure the prompt discharge of advices concerning vessels operations especially on vessel safety, oil loss, cargo safety and security. 3.Facilitate the operational and administrative requirements of the vessels particularly, minimum safe manning, fuel requirements, clearances, discharging parameters, certificates, permits and documents needed for vessel voyage. 4.Maintain updated class survey records particularly those concerning marine-related appliances/devices. 5.Handle all investigations concerning matters related to vessel officers/ crews’ discipline, morale, derangements, or incidents/accidents. 6.Assist the crewing officer in determining the performance of the complement of all vessels. 7.Implement good housekeeping onboard vessels. 8.Conduct fuel load calculation, as well as validate the same with voyage and fuel requirements of the vessels in coordination with technical. 9.Initiate, submit and monitor to completion Job Orders to Technical Dept. and Requisitions for any defects, deficiencies, breakdown or requirements of vessels. 10.Conduct regular performance evaluation of vessel crew and officers. 11.Facilitates the operational and administrative requirements of the vessels particularly all vessel requisitions. 12.To report the following items to the General Manager and Operational Manager a. Vessel weekly voyage compilation b. Lube oil consumptions c. Fuel oil consumptions d. Concerns and urgent matters e. Vessel operational equipment status I. Machinery II. Navigational III. Safety equipment 13. Performs other duties as directed by General Manager and operational manager. The above functions and responsibilities may be reasonably updated by the Company. QUALIFICATIONS EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION: Bachelor’s/College Degree in Mechanical Engineering. Preferably with Licensed EXPERIENCE: At least two or more years in Shipping Operations REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE: Flexibility and ability to work on different aspects. SKILLS/ABILITIES: Highly analytical, systematic and works with highest degree of integrity. Must have a passion for quality service and has a quick response time. Self-starter and able to work independently or with a team. Demonstrated strong work ethic and flexible hours as needed; ability to drive results and meet strict deadlines.

Job Title: Water and Waste Water Treatment Service Technician
Job Description: Qualifications: Candidate must possess at least Vocational Diploma/Short Course Certificate in Engineering (Mechanical) or equivalent. Required language(s): English, Filipino At least 3 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. With Tesda NCII Certificate is an advantage Vast experience in installation, repairs and maintainance of pumps, motors, pipes, and electrical equipment. Has a background in pipe fitting and plumbing. Can work with minimal supervision. Must be honest, self-motivated and has the ability to work with others. Must be willing to travel and work for long hours , if necessary Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving ability Excellent physical condition and flexibility to work long shifts and overnight Knowledge of building codes, safety regulations, and safety practices Ability to read and follow blueprints and rough drawings Knows how to drive a motorcycle or automotive Duties and Responsibilities: Be accountable for the day-to-day operations of the wastewater treatment. Execute process sampling to accurately gauge and monitor levels. Monitor wastewater operations. Analyze instantaneous and historical data to decide on needed operational adjustments. Assist operating management in the installation and maintenance of environmental compliance measures. Assist management in interpreting and applying technical regulatory requirements. Log all operational data and produce frequent reports. Troubleshoot process, instrumentation, data and mechanical problems. Perform basic maintenance, repair and calibration. Respond to any related emergencies. Work closely with adjacent farming operations to insure land application of treated wastewater is compliant. Monitor cost control measures for environmental compliance. Remain up-to-date on new developments in regulatory changes. Communicate effectively with plant management regarding all waste treatment. Once you're hired you can enjoy the following benefits such as: Free Accommodation Free Parking Bonuses & Incentives Higher Salary offered depends on Expertise/Credentials

JOB DESCRIPTION: Project management processThis is the most important area and the primary role of the PMO is to ensure development and implementation of consistent as well as standardized business processes.As a part of the project management process, PMO helps in creating a common set of principles, practices, and templates for managing various organizational projects. Standardization refers to ease of movement for manager between different or multiple projects as well as quick learning curve of new project managers.Through creation of project management templates, the use of standard components or principles for multiple projects is ensured and this, in turn, saves both time and money for any organization. Data gatheringThe PMO is responsible for gathering of relevant project data and has to produce information to be presented for review by the management. Based on updates by project managers related to a single or multiple projects, the PMO will be responsible for tracking the overall status of those projects.They will assist in standardization of the compilation of information and ways of reporting the same to the management. Portfolio managementIf an organization has already implemented project portfolio management (PPM), it is the responsibility of the PMO to manage and facilitate the entire process. The responsibilities will include:Managing resource forecast or creating a resource capacity plan. This will help in understanding the availability of various resources for organizational projectsEnable capture of project requests and ensure each of those requests have enough relevant information that can aid in the assessment of that projectMaintaining an updated status of projects that are underway and those that have requests pending reviewImplement prioritization and scoring models for better assessment of the requests that should be approved FOR FASTER PROCESSING, PLEASE SEND YOUR UPDATED CV TO: [email protected]

Job Summary: The position is responsible to manage company’s supply of products and services, strategizing to find cost-effective deals and suppliers. Procurement Manager’s duty is to discover the best way to cut procurement expenses, and to oversee the over-all procurement process. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES 1. Ensuring materials needed by all departments and operating units are available at the time needed while promoting cost saving procurement strategies. 2. Managing daily purchasing activities, managing staff, and allocating tasks. 3. Maintaining the supplier database, purchase records, and related documentation. 4. Lead activities related to strategic procurement or tactical purchasing 5. Develop policies and procedures in coordination with other groups that will support continuity of operations. 6. Evaluates contractor and supplier's cost proposals and conducts pre-bid clarification meetings, pre-award conferences or negotiations 7. Managing that all procured items meet the required quality standards and specifications. 8. Building and maintaining long-term relationships with vendors and suppliers; Managing supplier relations and negotiating contracts, prices, timelines, etc. 9. Preparing cost estimates and managing procurement budgets. 10. Perform all task assigned by General Manager from time to time. QUALIFICATIONS EDUCATION: Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering or Logistic/Transportation, Maritime Studies or equivalent. EXPERIENCE: At least 3-5 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. With proven capacity to establish strategic sourcing strategies for materials or technologies that are available in the market. Experience in Shipping Industry is a must. REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE: Must be a forward-looking master communicator and negotiator with learning capability and growth mindset to go beyond the basic buying concept Deep knowledge of inventory and supply chain management. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Purchasing Software. · Knowledge on import and export documentation and procedures · Solid understanding of procurement processes, policy, and systems (e.g., Acumatica, SAP, ERP) SKILLS/ABILITIES: Resourceful, trustworthy, independent, physically fit and mature to dealing with suppliers Outgoing personality and service driven with a positive and “can do” attitude Able to handle stress under tight timelines Accurate and precise attention to detail

Job Summary The Radio Operator is responsible for receive and record time signals, weather reports, and other information important to the smooth operation of the vessels. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES 1. Responsible for the operations on radio communication lines. 2. Update reports and relay information to all concerned parties in order to avoid potential inconvenience . 3. Coordinate radio-related aspects of locating and contacting ships that are missing or in distress. 4. Operate sound-recording equipment in order to record signals and preserve broadcasts for purposes such as analysis by intelligence personnel. 5. Review applicable regulations regarding radio communications, and report violations. 6. Communicate with receiving operators in order to exchange transmission instructions. 7. Send, receive, and interpret coded messages. 8. Broadcast weather reports and warnings. 9. Determine and obtain bearings of sources from which signals originate, using direction-finding procedures and equipment. 10. Maintain station logs of messages transmitted and received for activities. 11. Monitor emergency frequencies in order to detect distress calls and respond by dispatching emergency equipment. 12. Perform all task assigned by superior from time to time. QUALIFICATIONS EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION: Graduate of a 4-year course, preferably an Engineering graduate EXPERIENCE: At least 1 year working experience in the related field is required for this position. REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE: · Ensure smooth data gathering. Knowledge in radio lines and communications Knowledge in computer and software SKILLS/ABILITIES: Must be organize, team player and have a passion for quality service and has a quick response time Team player, organized and self-starter Highly analytical mind with strong attention to detail Strong written and oral communication skills

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES A. Responsible for the performance testing in the project: produce the project performance testing plan, performance scheme, and do performance testing and analysis of the testing result. B. Responsible for the Bottleneck Identification of performance and capacity of payment plus: master the key business and internal call links of the payment platform in platform plus, write the end to end performance compression script, perform end to end performance testing of payment platform in platform plus, and analyze performance bottlenecks and risk assessment for performance test results (Whether or not to deteriorate). Performance optimization scheme of performance bottleneck and performance depressions; precipitation and construction of some automatic scanning mechanism of performance. C. Responsible for building the capacity monitoring platform of payment platform in platform plus, monitoring the use of hardware, software, network, IO and the payment platform in platform plus, timely analysis and early warning of online performance capacity bottleneck points. D. Responsible for system shrinkage, expansion, procurement and so on, in the case of insufficient resources, some additional evaluation and implementation work. SKILLS, QUALIFICATIONS, AND COMPETENCIES Must come from a technical background with strong competency on performance testing and tuning Previous experience in capacity management, site risk engineer role, product and software development and quality assurance. They must be able to demonstrate the ability to work effectively in a team environment and deliver successful results. Strong background in the following languages and technologies: o Open source technology stacks which include Linux (Ubuntu/Red hat), MySQL and Java o Popular open source frameworks to testing such as IntelliJ, Selenium, JUnit o ISTQB/Java certification is an advantage

RESPONSIBILITIES: The S&D Reservoir Engineer is responsible for planning, organizing, coordinating, designing and conducting well and reservoir modeling initiatives, resource assessment studies, advanced well testing and analysis and recommend solutions to resource management constraints that conform to operating and quality standards of the company. Conceptualizes and tests appropriate resource management and development strategies for the interpretation of the dynamics of the reservoir and ensuring the sustainable and optimized performance of the geothermal resource. These inputs guide management in decisions that are critical to the company's economic sustainability and growth. The Reservoir Engineer is responsible for providing high-quality technical services to clients using industry-standard simulation software, high-performance computing resources, and state-of-the-art modeling techniques. He/she is also responsible for preparing the project budget. Formulates resource characterization and capacity prediction strategies relevant to all well and reservoir analytical and numerical modeling, resource assessment, advanced well testing and analysis to ensure compliance with the organization mandate and customer requirements; Plans, organizes, controls, and coordinates reservoir engineering activities that are aligned with the sustainability initiatives and priorities of the company; Plans, organizes, and coordinates assigned S&D activities to ensure established work standards and objectives are met; Recommends programs and budgetary/ resource requirements for the implementation of reservoir engineering activities, in coordination with concerned groups; IMPLEMENTATION: Performs assessment to diagnose operational needs and concerns of the company and to evaluate impact of technical issues to resource sustainability and operational efficiency; Conceptualizes and performs resource sustainability studies and creates solutions that will address concerns of the company; Leads a sustainability team project related to reservoir engineering and modeling starting from the preparation of project charter, preparation of work program, stage gating, and implementation; Leads cross-functional work teams who will address issues on efficiency and quality of operations of the company, if needed; Secures resources based on the company’s strategic requirements, and seeks alternatives if necessary; Performs reserve estimation and resource assessment studies to determine the field generating capacity that will serve as input to the development strategy and evaluating the feasibility of the project; Initiates well and reservoir evaluation and interpretation and related activities for the business unit to resolve sustainability and developments issues such as but not limited to sustainable production levels and optimum production and injection well performance using both industry standard and company-developed methods such as well test analysis and modeling; Formulates detailed, cost effective, and appropriate technical solutions to optimize well and reservoir performance through the conduct of special research studies and application of appropriate methods; Performs well productivity prediction to determine the new well capacity and resource sustainability studies that will serve as input to the well geoscientific prognosis and drilling strategy; Recommends and leads the design of special well testing programs to measure specific well and reservoir properties; Prepares or assists in the preparation of feasibility studies and economic assessments of proposed projects and programs of the Strategic Business Unit Sustainability Team and collaborates with the Strategic Business Unit Sustainability Team in the preparation of project and program proposals; Reviews and endorses Terms of Reference (TOR) for 3rd party service providers to ensure conformance of service to the company's requirements; Evaluates and recommends 3rd party service providers, as needed, in accordance to Corporate policies on engagement of external services; Evaluates effectiveness of program/project based on operating standards and compliance with agreed actions, and recommends remedial actions when needed; QUALITY MANAGEMENT: Participates in the periodic review and updating of quality standards relevant to resource characterization and capacity prediction activities and well design and intervention strategies including but not limited to, operating procedures, project/program approval criteria, etc. Reviews wellbore and reservoir modeling results and performs quality check of relevant data using applicable software; Develops, implements, coordinates and monitors quality standards in collaboration with relevant stakeholders and subject matter experts, including but not limited to, operating procedures, project/program approval criteria, etc. CLIENT MANAGEMENT: Provides diagnosis/technical analysis of operational and resource management needs and concerns of clients by conducting appropriate reservoir engineering analysis and providing appropriate engineering solutions Convenes, represents the team in routine and high level strategy meetings, as required, to align projects, programs, and work prioritization with Management, Commercial/Operational Teams, and other stakeholders relative to the short, mid, and long term strategies of Resource Management. DOCUMENTS / DATA MANAGEMENT: Implements and maintains information management systems and/or software applications to ensure data security and data integrity for Sustainability and Development operations. Maintains and updates a data and information dashboard relevant to achievement of Resource Management’s strategic requirements. Develops, documents and implements procedures that support the policies on the safekeeping, upload, retrieval, distribution and retention of documents relevant to the Sustainability and Development operations such as, but not limited to, research materials, technical documentation, etc. Coordinates with IT and other groups for the development, maintenance and improvement of the database and information management system related to Reservoir Engineering. POLICY FORMULATION PROCESS / DESIGN / PROCESS IMPROVEMENT: Develops and amends systems, processes, an procedures within S&D to increase operational efficiency Coordinates with relevant stakeholders and subject matter experts for evaluation and feasibility studies of new technologies and techniques which can be adopted for process and systems improvement.Recommends innovations in reservoir engineering practices and techniques and solutions to technical issues RESOURCE/ LOGISTICS / FACILITIES MANAGEMENT: Plans, acquires and manages utilization of the resources allocated to each facility related work program and when applicable, develops strategies to manage resource limitation. Assists in the preparation of, and administers operating and capital expenses budgets for the Sustainability and Development Team projects and activities. Conducts proper inventory, handling, storage and maintenance of S&D equipment to ensure availability of such equipment, instruments, materials and relevant supplies at all times, and recommends corrective/preventive action when appropriate. COMMUNICATIONS MANAGEMENT: Represents the team in high level interactions with management, experts, consultants and service providers as needed, particularly in areas concerning reservoir engineering Convenes, represents the team in routine and high level strategy meetings, as required, to align projects, programs, and work prioritization with Management, Commercial and Operational Teams, and other stakeholders relative to the short, mid, and long term strategies of Resource Management. Convenes/ Participates in routine and high level technical meetings, as required, to implement and monitor progress of programs, discuss current technical issues and concerns, and keep abreast of latest developments relevant to Reservoir Engineering operations, site field operations and resource management teams. Conducts periodic visits and inspection trips to the business unit concerned to ensure proper coordination and effective implementation of S&D programs Builds a network of technical experts, both internal and external, such as but not limited to research and technical groups of potential and existing partners, technical representatives of suppliers, etc. QUALIFICATION: Candidate must possess at least Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam) in Engineering - Chemical, Mechanical or Physics At least 2- 5 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position

Job Summary: The Site Quantity Surveyor is responsible for the processing of the billings to and claims against the Customer, the evaluation of the Subcontractor billings, and the monitoring of project costs against budget to ensure profitability of the project. Duties and Responsibilities:Review the completeness of details of the accomplishment reports from the Operations team to ensure accuracy of the billing to the Customer.Identify claims with cost implication against the Customer or other trade contractor through the review of relevant documentations to increase the potential profitability of the Company.Prepare cost proposals for claims based on quantification and competitive pricing to increase the potential profitability of the Company.Prepare and collate relevant and required documentations to support the billings to the Customer or the claims.Reconcile accomplishment or claims with the Customer (or other trade contractor) to agree on billable quantities (and/or rates as applicable) that is fair and profitable to the Company.Monitor the release of the Certificate of Completion through the close coordination with the Customer and the concerned departments to support the final billing to the Customer.Monitor Customer billings and claims up to receipt of payment and resolve any technical concerns encountered to ensure timely collection of amounts due to the Company and prevent delays.Validate the claims of the Subcontractor through the evaluation of the billings, review of the completeness of supporting documents, and reconciliation of the quantity accomplished to prevent overpayments due to overcharging of Subcontractors.Review the Certificate of Payment to the Subcontractor and monitor verification of the charges by the concerned departments to confirm the accuracy of the computation and the payment details.Issue, through the Project Manager (PM) or Project In-charge (PIC), Certificate of Completion to the Subcontractor for scopes of work completed to facilitate the processing of the final billing.Monitor the actual cost of the Project, such as materials and labor costs, against budget to determine the status of the project cash flowAssist in the supervision of the PCE II and III in their daily transactions to ensure proper performance of their technical functionsReview documentation and reports prepared by the PCE II and III to confirm the accuracy of the data and validate the relevance of the information.Coordinate with the Customer, Subcontractor, PM/PIC, and Department Heads for the efficient resolution of concerns and efficient processing of billings and claims.Maintain a systematic and well-organized filing system for documentations related to Customer billings, claims and subcontractor billings to ensure completeness of records and to provide easy access to reference.Assist in the creation and implementation of department policies, procedures and forms for the efficient and effective performance of department processes and to ensure controls are in place.Provide back-up relief for other team members and perform ad-hoc tasks that may be assigned from time to time to provide support to the department and the CompanyQualifications: Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering (Civil). Required language(s): English, Filipino At least 5 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably Supervisor/5 Yrs & Up Experienced Employee specialized in Engineering - Others or equivalent.

Copy and paste this link on your browser to know what it means: https://cloud.ph.jobstreetmail.com/PH-JS-CAN-Under-Verification Duties: Inspects, tests, adjusts, and repairs electric, electronic, mechanical, and pneumatic instruments and systems used to indicate, record, and control generating operations in conventional or nuclear power electric generating plant: Inspects meters, indicators, and gauges to detect abnormal fluctuations. Tests accuracy of flowmeters, pressure gauges, temperature indicators, controllers, radiation counters or detectors, and other recording, indicating or controlling instruments to locate defective components in system, using test equipment, such as pressure gauges, mercury manometers, potentiometers, pulse and signal generators, oscilloscopes, transistor curve tracers, and ammeters, voltmeters, and wattmeters. Traces out and tests electronic solid state and vacuum tube circuitry and components to locate defective parts in analog and digital, protection, or radiation monitoring systems, using test equipment, schematics, and maintenance manuals. Removes defective instruments from system, decontaminates, disassembles, and cleans instruments, and replaces defective parts, using handtools. Reassembles instruments and replaces instruments in system, using handtools. Qualifications: Trustworthy, Dedicated and Committed Willing to work ASAP Work experience as Instrument Technician.

Job Description: Responsible for controlling and monitoring project total expenditures including verifying and checking of invoices and claims from suppliers, vendors and subcontractors to ensure that all project expenditures are captures ad properly recorded. Provide planning and cost controlling support for all projects which includes variation reporting, monitoring of milestone progress to the preparation of customer billing processes etc. Perform and manage project activity scheduling and monitoring. Perform technical and commercial review (subcontractor's quotations) for preparation of service agreements. Preparation of monthly reports for monitoring of activities on a daily basis and register all issues related to the projects promptly to the project manager and management. Coordinate and work with the project management team to resolve project issues to ensure the delivery/completion of the project work. Attend project meetings and discussions with the project management team and external clients. Perform project costing related reporting to the team and management's review on a monthly basis to ensure that expenditures are kept within the project budget. Provide cost control and planning advice to the internal project management team as and when required. Undertake any other ad-hoc duties as required.
